Reviews.Title: “Spartan in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: chutaiko
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this hotel is in a fantastic location being right on Euston Square and it's clean. Also the toiletries are pretty good for a 3 star hotel in London. Unfortunately, That's the end of the positives..... Now on the negative side... The room I had was 2 meters above street level on Euston Road, there were no attempts during the building or renovation of this hotel to apply any sort of sound dampening. The bed is as hard as a board and has the added bonus of the tops of the springs poking out. The shower head isn't adjustable and was pointed towards the wall. The room is about 50 centimeters larger than the bed and the desk is big enough to hold a glass.... This hotel is pretty good for being a 3 star hotel, unfortunately at 120 pounds, it's not a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Location is brilliant”
Reviews.Author: unknownis
Reviews.Content: Location is the seller here, just outside Euston station, very handy. Rooms are small, but ok - service was OK. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel like a criminal”
Reviews.Author: 443gerry1916
Reviews.Content: I checked in after 11pm to this hotel and my head office had made the booking and paid for it. The check in desk insisted I pay when the booking on their documentation clearly stated it had already been settled. After lots of coming and going with wispering in the back room it was stated that the company card had been rejected and I would have to pay. I suggested that I leave my card number as security but that we could sort this out first thing in the morning, I was booked in for two nights and had stayed previously as indeed had a number of my colleagues. I was allowed to go to my room, it was now midnight and I had an early start the next morning. fifteen minutes later the phone rang and when I answered it the reception guy asked me to bring down my passport!!!! Words fail me at the ineptitude of the staff...I could go on and on but I wont, I will never stay at this hotel again though, nor will my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Great Location For Trains/Tube”
Reviews.Author: Wookie74EastLancs
Reviews.Content: Paid £90.00 inc continental breakfast which was ok, plenty of choice & self service. Fantastic location 2 mins walk from Euston, tube station opposite. Easy checkin - arrived at 2pm and rooms were cleaned and ready, nice polite girl on reception Traffic noise wasn't as bad as I expected for central London, 4th floor room. Very small room though with sliding door into bathroom which didn't seem to want to stay closed. Double bed & luckily only single ocupancy as the wardrobe was very small. Tea & coffee making facilities along with complimentary toiletries if you really want to cut down on items in your luggage. Would say it's a typical 3 star type of hotel, similar to a Travel lodge or Ibis? Never tried the wifi as could get a good 3G signal in room and breakfast room. If you like a good pint of real ale - only just round the corner from the Bree Louise, well worth a visit, something like 17 real ales and 9 ciders to chose from, a fantastic find and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The wifi that wasn't”
Reviews.Author: lemoyne1
Reviews.Content: We choose this place because of the convenience and wifi. The hotel is convenient, but the wifi is very flaky. Even when we arrived the receptionist advised us wifi was difficult to connect to in our room when there were many users because the signal would be loaded down. It is a rubbish explanation - that's not how wifi works. We got a good connection for one computer, but nothing worked when we tried to second device. This looks like they have misconfigured wifi. You can use it at the breakfast room is better, but slow. The shower is mold, but otherwise it is clean. The breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “comfortless in every way...”
Reviews.Author: lydia g
Reviews.Content: surly reception, ground floor disabled room by reception for an able-bodied traveller at 10.30 pm at night (too tired to say - "why?'), the smell of carpet freshener so strong it made my eyes water, cold - no additional heating or blankets, edges of the room dirty, bed hard and, when i made a cup of tea in effort to cheer myself up - the cup had a 3 inch crack in it in addition to a couple of good size chips in the rim. No hairdryer, or even power socket anywhere near the mirror. needed v good eyesight to see the tv as was tucked away in an alcove a good 16 feet from the bed head - I'm sure if you are in London for the night, or for a business meeting you can do better than this - I checked out at 5am, Euston Rd and the early morning traffic cheering me up. It's close to the station... that's about all it's got going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel for Euston & St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: csa_travel
Reviews.Content: I did an overnight stay at Euston Square in early January 2012. It was a very cold night and the hotel was warm and comfortable. The room was small as you would expect in London but perfectly adequate. It was clean and well fitted as was the shower room. Bed was too firm for me but that is a question of personal taste. Buffet breafast was good and plentiful and the breakfast room could easily cope with the influx of guests when I was there. Considering the high turnover of guests I thought the place was well presented. Staff were efficient and polite. The only reason I would not stop here again is that my room faced onto Euston Road and the soundproofing was just not good enough to cut out the constant roar of traffic and it is constant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: exeter95
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was close to the train station and it had wifi. First, my key didn't work. The next morning I woke to no hot water, then they "fixed" it and I had scalding water I couldn't shower in. The wifi went in and out and the hair dryer wouldn't work. The room was tiny and dirty and the worst part was that for $40 more a night I could have stayed at the nice Euston Hilton up the street. Management is never there and when I complained the staff said they could change my room (wouldn't have made a difference I'm sure) but otherwise there was nothing they could do. I wrote a letter and placed a formal complaint but no one has returned my call/email yet. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ru345
Reviews.Content: I stay here for 5 nights. Only plus of this hotel is location, just around the corner from Euston Square station. And 10 minutesâ€™ walk to Britain Museum. Initially I got room that wasnâ€™t ready. I come down and they switch me to different room. Room itself is ridiculously small. I had two pieces of luggage with me and was able to fit one smaller inside of very small closet. But another one had no place to put except to one side of bed. And it completely blocked pass way between bed and wall. Sink had missing guard. So if you drop something in it, it goes directly in drain tube. Also it had some cracks on it. Light is very uncomfortable as well, with only forensic bulbs in ceiling. No any local lamps next to the bed. So it was practically impossible to read in the bed. Bed is very small. And you can hear every sound coming from the next room, as well as every step upstairs. One night I was waken up by phone call at 4am because they screw up room number with no apology. Complimentary breakfasts are OK but do not expect anything fancy. Very basic - just cheese, ham, boiled eggs, croissants, bread, jam, yogurt, cereal, fruit salad. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOUGING, PAPER THIN WALLS,”
Reviews.Author: Dillon79
Reviews.Content: GOUGING: Price gouging is a pejorative term referring to a situation in which a seller prices goods or commodities much higher than is considered reasonable or fair. PAPER THIN WALL In traditional Japanese architecture, a shÅ�ji (éšœå­�) is a door, window or room divider consisting of translucent paper over a frame of wood which holds together a lattice of wood or bamboo.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly small rooms and somewhat run down.”
Reviews.Author: Brad-and-Susan
Reviews.Content: The only reason that this hotel is rated "Poor" instead of "Terrible" is because the price is quite reasonable, which I suppose is testiment to "you get what you pay for". Rooms are so small that the bathroom door cannot even open more than about a foot, because it bumps into the bed. Hotel lobby and bar area appear to not have been upgraded/refinished in over 50 years and as far as I am aware, there are no real ammenities to speak of. Other than being right across the street from a conference I was attending, I would not recommend this hotel for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - but some niggles!”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: 2nd time I have stayed here on business, hotel chosen for location (good) and price (very good compared to some nearby). Rooms are small - indeed tiny if you choose a single room or if you are unlucky. I left feedback with the hotel last time I stayed and am dissapointed to see that the same issues remain. 1 - the TVs in the rooms are at 90 degrees to the head of the bed so you either need to watch with your head propped at 90 degrees and end up with a very sore neck or you have to rearrange such that you sleep at the foot of the bed. Why can't they just put the TV on a wall or where it can be seen? 2 - the free WiFi wasn't working at all. This is pretty essential when on a business trip so I was pretty hacked off. This wasn't mentioned when I checked in as I may have considered not staying. It was the same last time too, so don't be fooled by the "free WiFi" stated on their website. This wasn't even available in the public areas. 3 - there is no heating in the bathrooms, nothing, zilch..... accordingly the bathrooms are freezing. I had to leave the door open all night to allow some warmth from the room to go into the bathroom. This doubled the noise from the traffic outside. 4 - is the noise which I appreciate isn't the fault of the hotel. If you are a light sleeper I recommend that you ask for a room away from the main road at Euston Sq station side. The noise was deafening from cars and ambulance siren all night long. On the plus side, the hotel is clean and the staff are very nice. Breakfast was good, and despite my niggles is does represent good value if you accept that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Matchbox Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JNS1965
Reviews.Content: I visited London for work and stayed here in a double room for its proximity to Euston Station. Yes it's very close to the station and only 5 mins walk. However, the hotel itself was a disappointment. The corridors were very tight and the rooms were even smaller. The bathroom was a joke. There was hardly any room to use the toilet! The cost was competetive but I would use any of the other eco-chains next time before this hotel ie Ibis, Premier Inn etc. Steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “OK but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: stepheng98
Reviews.Content: Booked in for course in London. Small room but clean and comfortable and very convenient for travel. The only problem being the paper thin walls (you could hear everything) so take earplugs if you are a light sleeper. The hotel restaurant is a good place to eat too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but small room”
Reviews.Author: Travelgang1
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute so didn't check reviews hotel ok but room was so small and I could not fit in the shower. Would stay again only if I could get a bigger room

Reviews.Title: “Sound Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daf1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 1 minute walk from Euston station and hence quite useful for a business trip. The rooms are rather basic, with little room to spare, but quite modern, clean, and adequate. The breakfast is continental, and my business colleagues were unhappy to forego bacon & egg for croissant / toast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pentonys
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything the traveller requires for a short week-end in London - close proximity to underground - spotlessly clean rooms - perfectly adequate breakfast - in-room safe - kettle for that great little pick-me-up drink of tea and at an affordable rate

Reviews.Title: “better go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller85
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel due to a last minute change in plans. overall it was not a pleasant experience. The guy who checked us in was very non challant and borderline rude, an was nit helpful at all. The bride accommodation was charged I'm advance without even informing us. The hotel was not fully booked an we were attributed the tiniest room someone could possibly imagine; ous suitcases couldn't even lay flat on the floor if not we couldn't walk nor open the main door nor open the washroom's door. The shower had mould and mildew and was very small too. the breakfast was very average and it was very noisy at night and in the early morning with doors slamming. the wifi connection goes off and on, just not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a noisy cupboard”
Reviews.Author: JohnKline
Reviews.Content: Usual overpriced London rubbish. Tiny room would have given a Hobbit claustrophobia and the noise from the road and some type of pump situated in the walls somewhere made sleeping virtually impossible. The prices are obviously based on the normal London tarrif of think of a number, double it and add Â£10. It was clean, but so is McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lambaston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Wednesday and Thursday night. I chose this hotel because of the location (Just a couple minutes walk from Euston Station), price and free wi-fi. The room was small but cozy. It was clean and comfortable. Shower was ok too. There was no plug to block the hole so I could not collect water. My main gripe about the bathroom was there was no towel rack. If you look in the hotel website you can see a picture of the bathroom and you will see a shelf with the towels neatly folded and kept there. Problem is that it is too high and I climb up on the toilet seat to get the towels. The TV in the room was good. There was a good selection of channels to choose from. I thought the blinds might not keep out the light at night but I did not have any problems nor did I have any issues with noise outside. There is a lift for access to the floors. There is no sensor on the lift doors and it closes fast without any warning. I've been caught a couple with that and it's not a pleasant experience. If someone weak gets caught in that it might cause injury. The restaurant was ok. I enjoyed the food and the price was reasonable. On one night I ordered a starter and main and they came out at the same time which I wasn't too happy about. But then it wasn't the normal waitress that took my order, it was some guy in a suit. I didn't try breakfast so can't comment. The main reason that sold me was the free wi-fi. However the connection was rubbish. It was too slow they may as well have not bothered. I was really disappointed with the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: besto83
Reviews.Content: a great hotel to stay in london... near soho and it's pubs, restaurants and shops, the tube is just behind the corner and some buses are not far (warren street). the hotel is clean and confortable... the staff is kind and always available. what a good surprise!!! ( breakfast was so good, brioches and all the things u need to start a good day)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but lacklustre”
Reviews.Author: DrShuggy
Reviews.Content: The Euston Square Hotel is extremely well sited for central London. I arrived early (12pm) and was told by a disinterested receptionist that I couldn't check in until 2. She made no attempt to see if any rooms were free and did not offer to store my bags. When I did manage to check in I found the room to be tiny but reasonably nicely decorated, clean and functional. Overnight the room was exceptionally noisy due to the paper thin walls which allowed me to hear my neighbours nocturnal visits to the bathroom as well as numerous slamming doors. Breakfast was included and was a pretty cheap but OK continental selection, I will say that the croissants were surprisingly delicious and much better than the usual stale and cold ones you get at these sort of places.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and neat, but small”
Reviews.Author: Innle_Bec
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Euston Square for one night as I arrived at Heathrow late and was travelling on the Eurostar at 6am. I was a bit worried by the reviews posted on here, but the convenience and relatively cheap (for London) rate outweighed my concern. Firstly; yes, the room was pretty small, but it would have seemed much larger with a single bed, and more importantly everything was at least clean and fresh. The bathroom was actually quite large and well-equipped, and the furniture modern. In my opinion it is what it claims to be, fairly modest accomodation in an expensive city. Basically you get what you pay for, and if you can afford better, go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Grim and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: SnakeWine
Reviews.Content: Small, grim, dark, noisy, poorly furnished rooms with paper thin adjoining walls and unwelcoming staff. Certainly not worth the nightly rate or undeserved three star status.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: Angierobrts
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. It was THE most expensive place we stayed on a 23 day European trip. They gave us twin beds when our reservation clearly said double bed. They had spotty wifi service and the restaurant was closed when we arrived. So we had to find a grocery store for dinner. The rooms were small and not so clean. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms - noisy”
Reviews.Author: Willis68
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed in this hotel recently and didn't enjoy his stay at all. The location was handy for all he had to do in London, but he said the room was tiny and uncomfortable. The bathroom was very small and the room was very noisy. My young son who travelled with my husband is usually quite excited by hotels and very forgiving but he said 'You need to find us another hotel in London next time Mum - that place was tiny'. Might be ok if traveling alone, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay on average”
Reviews.Author: raisinchicky
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, right by Euston Station. Room was small but well appointed, very attractive decor, felt nice and clean. Same for the bathroom, tiny but smart and clean. Wifi worked very well, but then I was on the 1st floor. Staff were polite and helpful, breakfast was basic but perfectly adequate. On the downside, my room was right by the lift and stairwell so was very noisy with doors banging all night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but lots of traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: tanya123-11
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, reasonable cost for meals. Very heavy traffic noise. Convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Not enough space for Smurfs”
Reviews.Author: Andrew419
Reviews.Content: First the positives, location is very good. The negatives, the room was tiny, it would need an extension to be classed as a shoebox! Bathroom would be crowded for a Smurf. TV useless as it kept seizing up so basically watched a still photo. Zero WiFi in room even though advertised as all over the hotel. Orange juice at breakfast has to be drank out of white plastic disposable cups. Not good value for money for me personnaly but that is partly to do with supply and demand as everywhere was booked so the price was rather elevated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was close to my uni for graduation. We thought a three star hotel would be ok and didn't mind paying Â£117 for the star rating and location. That was until we arrived, our room was tiny, which isn't a problem normally as it was just somewhere to sleep for the night, but the bed was uncomfortable too- needed a knew mattress. The room was clean however the plaster was coming off the walls in places. We also received a wake up call at 6.10am that we didn't request when we informed reception we did not get an apology but were told that someone else hadn't received their wake up call. The TV didn't work. We had the continental breakfast which was nice enough. My parents also stayed in the hotel and had the English breakfast which wasn't nice the following morning they asked to have it refunded as they just wanted the continental and the hotel refused as they had paid in advance. The male staff we encountered at reception were nice and polite, the female staff were unhelpful and gave a "can't be bothered", "computer says no" impression. I would not recommend this hotel and I definitely would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: The_Aviat0r
Reviews.Content: Great location near Warren Street tube station and walking distance to Oxford Street. The room was tiny but clean and modern. The bed was rock hard as there was no mattress, but we asked for an extra blanket, which somewhat alleviated the discomfort. The room, situated at the end of the hallway, was quiet. Free wireless internet was nice, although it didn't work smoothly all the time. Most of the staff were nice and accommodating. The breakfast, while not that varied, kept us going till lunch. Overall we feel the hotel offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: CheshireS_11
Reviews.Content: I thnk that how you find this hotel entirely depends on the room you have. Mine was at the back with the huge air con vents outside the window so was very noisy. Others in our party had tiny rooms Rooms are very clean but the woodwork and furniture were chipped the walls and carpet marked. Shower rooms looked nice but the shower head in my room whirled round like a Catherine Wheel if you ran the water fast. Another in our party had no hot water at all for two days. The TVs in lots of rooms did not work at all and those that did froze after 15 mins or so and you had to turn them off and on again to get them to work. The staff just said they knew there was a problem. The bed was very hard as were the pillows. Breakfast is basic but ok. Good location and very convenient but would avoid staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good standard budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cscromarty
Reviews.Content: You might not want to go on holiday there but it has all the basics. Good shower, reasonable bed and very clean. Rooms very stark but for a night or two it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient to trains”
Reviews.Author: outsidenow
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but nice location.Breakfast buffet was fine. Easy to get to train stations & the tube. Very close to the British library.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: screename186338
Reviews.Content: This is a very, very, very bad hotel and extraordinarily overpriced. The room cost Â£87 per night and I'd have been disappointed paying Â£7. To summarise: - extremely noisy all night throughout hotel - guests not loud but hotel so cheaply constructed, every footstep can be heard - broken air conditioning unit in 2 rooms on 2 separate occasions, making a loud buzzing noise every 10 mins - breakfast - stale bread and hard cheese - tv not working in first room - tv fixed on wall facing away from bed with no chair so therefore no ability to watch tv

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expect”
Reviews.Author: nick j
Reviews.Content: this was my first time in london everything was amazing there. Arrived Hotel at 12pm but the checkin time was 2pm it didnt bother us at all coz the reception was very helpfull in storing our bagges and guiding us the direction towards london eye. wokeup next day to have breakfast in restaurant, it was continental breakfast with various choices of pastries and great selection of fruit yoghurts and several diferent kind on breadroll, fresh fruit salad and the list goes on. i would say it was very healthy breakfast and all staff performed well. my whole trip was just what i expect from everyone and everything. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and will definatley come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with poor service”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: Visited here also in June 2010, year ago. Location is great, that's why I booked this hotel again. Oxford street and Piccadilly Circus is within walking distance (10-20 minutes). There is lot of Tube stations nearby and Euston Square is actually right below hotel. St Pancras International is also within walking distance (10 min). Room is small, but it is very clean. The cleaners are the best what this hotel has to offer. Service at the desk has gone worse, some people even seem to hate mankind. Why do you work on customer service? Breakfast has gone worse too, they use Euro Shopper groceries - Euro Shopper really doesn't taste any good at all. Atleast put the empty Euro Shopper packages away so that customers can even think of something else. The wireless network had many problems and the desk seemed helpless. But if you do have any problems with the Guest network just ask the desk to reboot the device. Then it will work. Just ask them. The A/C kept odd noise and the walls are thin. We heard old chinese man trash talking from 7 am to 11 pm. Nevertheless, I will visit this hotel once again but do something to your breakfast and service attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, no curtains, clean”
Reviews.Author: BingoManchester Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, 5min walk from Euston and 15min walk to King's Cross and St Pancras Stations. However it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. My boyfriend and I wanted a room prior to getting the Eurostar but we had to climb over our bags to get in and out of the room/ bed/ bathroom. Whilst there were blinds in the bedroom, they were light and hence didn't block out any light so given it was the end of June, we struggled to get a good nights sleep as the light was streaming in through the window.

Reviews.Title: “Tend to agree with the majority of Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Feepthefaith Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: As most people have already stated this hotel is basic, clean and has no frills. Yes the beds are hard, yes the pillows are to, but its comfortable enough to sleep on for one night. The breakfast was limited, continental, and they were extremely rushed when we went, although we did go at the busiest time for breakfast so its kind of what you would have expected. Our room 103 had a very strange 'vibrating' noise in it, we thought at first it was the air conditionining, but soon realised it was not so if anyone else has stayed in this room would be good to know if you heard the same!! Did report to reception but they seemed unaware of any previous reports and said would pass on to the 'maintenance team'. All in all not bad value for money at Â£105.00 per night including 'breakfast', although booked late so if I had paid full room rate of Â£200 per night, would not have been impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique should not mean tiny!!!”
Reviews.Author: junior-twit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and whilst teh hotel was clean enough the room was the smallest we have ever been in, and even as cruisers we have never seen a bathroom so tiny. The walls are thin and there was a lot of noise from other guests coming and going, but no road noise. The free wifi we could not connect to and the cable in our room did not work either but the reception staff let me plug into their cable so that worked OK. Contintal breakfast was fine although crowded and on Friday morning one perso nwas trying to clean up and replenish which was never going to work not matter how hard he tried. Having said which if the price is right the hotel is very handily placed being right above Euston Square tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Good bolthole that delivers”
Reviews.Author: NicoleFerrinda
Reviews.Content: Overall good impression. Bathrooms modern, decent sized rooms, bed very hard tho. Very clean. Â  Breakfast was a decent buffet. Staff curteous and efficient. Free wifi a bonus. Convieniently situated. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Rooms small but functional.”
Reviews.Author: Granner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and found the accommodation clean and comfortable. The rooms are very small and the en-suite was minute. Having said this they were functional. Only thing that was missing was somewhere to hang a wet coat. The one drawback was the cooked breakfast. It consisted of 2 horrible grey sausages, streaky bacon, 2 fried eggs swimming in oil and a portion of beans. We had booked in advance for a cooked breakfast every morning but tried to cancel after the first and were told that it was not company policy to give refunds. Even so we did'nt try it again. On the positive side the continetal breakfast was very good. The location of the hotel was good with easy access to both Euston station and Euston Square underground and is within zone 1 for tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a night!”
Reviews.Author: Sue2404
Reviews.Content: If all the beds in the hotel are like the one we had I would recommend that you stay elsewhere. The mattress was rock hard which would have been just about acceptable had the pillows not been thin and hard as well. Even the duvet managed to be hard! My neck still hasn't recovered. The lift floor is appalling and a real safety hazard. Aside from that it wasn't bad - clean everywhere although looking a bit battered in some areas, decent breakfast and, despite it's appearance (tiny, 'minimal' - more like a door handle in appearance), an incredibly good powerful shower. The room was tiny but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “The staff really make this hotel, they can't do enough for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: Becky072
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, functional, excellent location & terrific value for money!!! I stayed May 6th - 8th and was very pleased with all aspects of this hotel. For this reason i shall be booking a return visit from 1st - 3rd July! The Reception staff printed us maps of places we wanted to visit; which was a massive help. The Bar staff were friendly & chatty. There is only a little outside patio at the front of the hotel but they were happy to put a table outside for us 'smokers'. We didn't mind the fact that the hotel is located next to the Tube, it's central London after all not the Lake District!!! I've been to London 4 times over the past 2 years and have always been disappointed with the cleanliness of the hotels; not so in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jonny187147
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Euston Square hotel for one night in May 27th. My stay was really pleasant and the check in was very prompt the staff was outstanding. I arrived early they kept our luggage in the luggage room. Two young members of staff one chinese looking girl and one asian guy at reception gave me 5 star service didn't get there names, they booked outstanding day tour i would recommend anyone to book. The only two problems i faced was the wireless internet access but again as i said the young guy who gave me checked in fixed the problem promptly. And the second issue is food!!!!!!! very bad choice of menu!!!! specially Lunch menu is awefull!!!!! It made me felt i was staying at home but the food made me felt like i was at my mother in law's house!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hardest bed I've ever slept on.”
Reviews.Author: TheOtelNspector
Reviews.Content: Positives: location and proximity to Euston station, new rooms, wireless Internet, very clean and updated and the shower. Negatives: the size of the room. The entire room was about 8' x 12', including the bathroom. The bed was up against the window and that left little room for luggage and two adults. We could feel every spring. Pretty busy location, so bring some earplugs. Conclusion: good location, professional staff, decent breakfast, clean and modern, but microscopic rooms and probably the worst bed we've ever slept upon. The room was very clean, but the bed was really uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay for price”
Reviews.Author: Calan-uk
Reviews.Content: Being a seasoned visitor to the Capital i was slightly concerned when i read some of the reviews on Trip advisor regarding the Euston Square Hotel, unfortunately these negative reviews were all true. On arrival the Hotel is completely covered in scaffolding which i am sure is only a temporary measure, however we were not informed that work would be taking place during our stay. I attempted a check in at 13.15 and was informed in no uncertain terms that check in was 14.00 and after, No exceptions! The reception area and bar do have the feel of a Hostel (as previous reviewers have stated) and do not give the welcoming feel a reception area should. Once we had checked in (after 14.00) we were pointed to our room on the 3rd floor, the lift is a serious health and safety issue, all the flooring has peeled off and causes serious tripping hazards (especially to the elderly), the corridor to our room was dark and needed a little TLC, the room was just big enough for a Â¾ bed and nothing else, heavily stained fixings and a cracked sink were the most off putting issues, however the rest of the room was acceptable. The breakfast was a complete joke, a tray with rolled ham and processed cheese was the most appetising thing available, a bowl of what appeared to fruit was also on show, but as we had prepaid we decided to make the best of the food available, come 11.00 i wished i hadnâ€™t bothered, a upset stomach and the next hour spent in the WC kind of put a dampener on the day. Surprisingly the Hotel is quite peaceful at night, and the bed was comfortable enough to gain a decent night sleep, but we were awoken at 09.00 when we thought someone was trying to break the wall down from the room next door, after the bed started to shake i had to go next door and see what was going on, what i found was most annoying, the hotel cleaner was carrying out her duties in the noisiest fashion available, no point asking her to be quiet as she couldnâ€™t speak English, however a demonstration to her of Noise and how annoying it was seemed to get though (well for the next hour). Overall the hotel would be worth booking for a single night stay if you are intending to eat every meal out and only go in the Hotel to sleep, the majority of the staff were good and very pleasant. If you pay around the Â£70.00 region you have got a decent deal but i wouldnâ€™t pay more than that for this standard of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJB47
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Euston Square Hotel on a recent business trip to London. Despite its convenient location around the corner from Euston Station and across the street from the Euston Square tube stop, the single room was unacceptably small, even by London standards. It was barely twice the width of the uncomfortable (lumpy) single bed. The Internet connection did not work, and the breakfast was a disaster, with the servers constantly being reminded to refill the serving trays and coffee urns that, even had they been full, offered only unappetizing fare. I should have paid $30 to $50 more and stayed at a name hotel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Aelwyn
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay at this hotel in a single room. The location was extremely convenient for my business the following day and, as it turns out, was quite convenient for a bit of shopping and dining as well. Being near the Euston Rail Station, Oxford Street shops and the University meant that there were a lot of nice cafes and coffee shops nearby and plenty of shopping for the casual city stroller. The hotel itself was nothing special on the outside. When I entered the lobby, I was a little worried as it looked more like a hostel than a proper hotel with it's dorm-like recreation and sitting rooms. The front desk staff was nice enough but again, it felt like much less than I expected from the reviews I had read. Climbing the archaic and narrow stairwell and trudging down the lengthy corridor to my room continued to make me feel as if I had made a mistake. When I finally reached my room at the end of the hall maze, I opened the door to find a small but very charming little room. It was nicely appointed and modern with a sizable closet, electronic safe, LCD television and comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but modern, exceedingly clean and again, well appointed. Considering I was only viewing the hotel as a place to sleep, the quality and comfort of the room was the most important aspect and it lived up to or exceeded my expectations. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: paulunitedkingdom Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very good. The room was smaller than small, could only just walk around the bottom of the bed, had to lean on the wall. The bathroom only had a shower, the bathroom had a sliding door, this gives an idea of the size of the room, u wouldn't have been able to open a door! It was only a continental breakfast which was disappointing. Left a feed back sheet in the hotel but as yet had no response from them.

Reviews.Title: “Just at the metro station, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LynnaBudapest
Reviews.Content: Everithyng was great, especially the breakfast :-), nice and modern enterior, helpful staff, clean, close to metro and not noisy, small room but ok. The offered tour (with goldentours) was also great. We really disliked the shower head, wich is quite modern and environmentally sound (other people like it). We would prefer to chose between this and the normal type with pipe and adjustable head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but paper thin walls to rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Lisi_rosebud
Reviews.Content: Euston Square Hotel is in a perfect location which made travelling around really easy. Free Internet and TV in the room, big wardrobe, kettle with tea and coffee provided and a hair dryer all included. Breakfast was good, cereals, croissants, toast etc... The hotel is clean, modern and friendly but the rooms are small with paper thin walls so prepare to listen to your neighbours TV at 2am. When I went the heating was constantly on to so if you get too hot, you have the option of opening the window to hear busy traffic (opposite a hospital so a lot of sirens) or use the air-conditioning which makes crazy noises and sounds as if its about to fall off the wall. Other than the few poor qualities, it is a fab hotel and I would probably go back again as the value for money is amazing considering how good the location is. (Euston Train/Tube Station - 1min walk, Warren Street Tube - outside the door) (Oxford street - about 20min walk) (Madame Tussauds - about 20min walk)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - good location I guess”
Reviews.Author: ARWEL_ANGLESEY
Reviews.Content: Looks nice from the outside... not as nice but still not bad. Great location - near to Warren St tube station and to the Northern line. Rooms a bit small, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Probably stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hannah401
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, I'd say it's a tiny bit over priced but good location 15 minute walk to soho/westend & between Â£7-10 in a cab. Rooms are basic and quite small but clean and tidy, not very noisey considering the hotel is located on a corner of a busy road, I stayed 3 nights and slept very well. The continental breakfast was nice, I wouldnt advise ordering a full english as it's an extra Â£6.50 and I don't think it was worth that, just stick to whats included in the price. Staff were very helpfull and friendly. Overall I'd rate the hotel 4/5 and I would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: isobelmalloy
Reviews.Content: r oom cramped hot and outdoor noise horrendous. The hotel could do with a makeover. The smell from the drains in the toilet was awful. The showerhead was not in the correct place as it hit the shower door. The breakfast was acceptable . The staff on the desk were helpful. The address is in North gower street so confusing.. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok I guess”
Reviews.Author: Grarkko
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in February 2011. Location is great, right next to subway station. It'll take around 15-20 minutes to walk to Central London (Oxford Street etc.). Breakfast was minimal, none of that English Breakfast stuff there so if you need beans and bacon, you have to go eat it somewhere else. However cereal, bread etc. was just fine. Rooms are small, that doesn't bother me, I was expecting that. The biggest problem is that all the rooms seem to have that door which is connected to the room next to it -> you can here everything from the next room (our neighnours had a fight and the lady was crying). So if you decide to go to this hotel, bring earplugs. Traffic noise can be heard, but the sound of sirens is just basic noise and it doesn't bother me. Staff was quite helpful, even though when checking in the lady was less than excited to welcome us. All the other staff members were friendly. Free Wi-Fi worked ok. Hotel bar/restaurant ok.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Tootsk
Reviews.Content: The Euston Square Hotel does exactly what it says on the tin... Provides clean, comfortable accomodation while away from home. No frills but adequate. Staff are welcoming and attentive. Breakfast was ok, although only continental on offer unless you wanted to pay extra for a full English. My only gripe (apart from paying for breakfast!) was that the corridors felt more like halls of residence rather than a hotel - was a bit like being back at uni.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe
Reviews.Content: Got a reasonable deal, expectations were not high and therefore I was not disappointed. Needed a place to crash after a late-ish night at the London Forum so this was ideal, located within easy walking distance of Warren St (Northern Line) with Euston Square tube just across the road. Good Euston main line proximity too. Friendly staff, no queues in the small reception area and lift access to rooms. The tiny size of the rooms is somewhat surprising. Smallest room I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. You could really open the bathroom door fully as it hit the bed. Same deal with the en-suite in terms of proportions. Very, very small. All that said I spent all of about 6 hours in the room and had no trouble sleeping. Nice and warm with good soundproofed windows that kept the traffic noise to a minimum. Clean, simple dÃ©cor, linen and all the usual basics catered for. Breakfast was included and the buffet of cereal, fruit, ham, cheese, croissants and toast was pretty decent. I did spot people having a full English on the way out so might be worth asking about this if you are hungry. Would not want to stay here for more than a night or two max but if you can get a deal I would recommend to anyone requiring a place to put their head down after a night out or before an early train out of Euston.

Reviews.Title: “First time i've ever written a review - DONT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3H3
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is very small, but it is clean and that is not the problem - its the noise. The traffic noise from outside (which is significant and constant) is a welcome distraction to drown out the noise of the hotel which features: paper thin walls - I could literally hear the guy in the room next door brushing his teeth and clearing his throat, people stomping up and down the corridor all hours of the night, doors slamming, walking around on the floor above, and the groan of the ageing lift. I finally managed to get to sleep about 12, then was awoken at 1am by a door slamming. This is the first review I have ever written on a site like this - but if you are looking for a reasonable nights sleep before a meeting in London like I was, honestly dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: AchyFeet
Reviews.Content: Although room is small, I have to say everything else is satisfactory for the price, compared to everything else in this expensive city. room is clean and the bed is comfortable. staff is helpful. Location is extremely convinient-close to 3 tube stations with multiple lines. There was a partial tube strike on the day we were flying out, we still managed to find a tube train that takes us to Paddington to catch the Heathrow train. A few things that would have made it much better: (1)allowing guests to take in before 2pm if room is available. (2)a chair for the desk. (3)slightly larger shower (the bathroom actually had more space for a larger shower).

Reviews.Title: “Small & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Solotrip
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£150pn due to the tube strike - too much! The room was very small, I had to walk around side-ways; the bathroom was ridiculously small - I couldn't turn around in the shower. The room looked like it had recently been refurbished ie the fixtures & fittings were good. Double glazing was good & kept it pretty quiet at night with a very busy road outside. Breakfast was very basic continental only. This was a strange hotel; new fixtures & fittings in an old B&B sums it up for me.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get a deal and only have overnight bags.”
Reviews.Author: SaltsUK
Reviews.Content: The majority of the reviews are correct, definitely about the size of the rooms. There is about 1foot all around the edge of a normal double bed so if you had suitcases, it would be a real struggle (they wouldn't fit under the bed either). Also only had one bedside table as no room on the other side as this is where the capsule wardrobe is. As we were only staying the night it suited us fine but I do think the hotels website calling it a boutique hotel very misleading, it is not. It is of a similar standard to an Ibis or Travelodge with smaller rooms. We asked for quiet rooms and were given rooms at the back which were just that and we slept well with no noise what so ever.. I would also ask for rooms away from the lift as its one of those that tells you when it is going up/down and arriving at which floor etc. The rooms opposite the lift entrance must be able to hear every word. The bathroom's are also tiny (the width of a toilet) and have to have a sliding door as there is definitely no room to open a door inwards or outwards. There is TV and coffe making facilities and the room was pretty clean. The hotel lobby is pleasant as is the bar but it was only open from 5.30pm despite there being loads of staff on reception doing nothing. We got back after the theatre about 11pm and the hotel bar was happy to stay open for as long as any guest wanted. All the staff were friendly and I was impressed that after I left an expensive cashmere scarf in the bar over night, it had been handed in to reception so I could retrieve it the next morning. Continental breakfast was adequate (cereals, ham, cheese, toast, bread, pain au chocolates/raisons & croisants, jam, honey etc, tea, coffee & orange juice). There is an option to pay extra for full English at Â£6.80 which my parents did and they were happy with the quality. The hotel is a 5 min walk from Euston station 15minutes from Kings Cross / St Pancras and I would stay again if I couldnt get anywhere better but would only pay max Â£85, it is not worth anymore than this.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the website”
Reviews.Author: Jazzzy-guy
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty functional, business travellers' hotel with small, clean but basic rooms, a very basic breakfast and dinner venue attatched. The website claims this is a boutique hotel - don't be fooled it is not. It is about the same price (perhaps a little cheaper) as the Travel Inn opposite but for all intents and purposes offers a similar service. In itself this is perfectly acceptable, but the misleading website is an annoyance. As a result, due to this clear attemp at misrepresentation, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Essgee14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight as we were travelling by train from Glasgow to Euston. Fab location....easy to get around London from here. Staff were delightful and very helpful. Only downside was the room size,but it was very clean. Breakfast was really good too

Reviews.Title: “Small room that was pretty noisy - although clean and close to tube”
Reviews.Author: mandadrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room and it was very small (what we had expected because the photos on their website do show that the rooms are small). I didn't factor in that the room was going to be so noisy. We heard a lot of traffic noise and could hear everything going on in the room next to us. The window also had a small blind that didn't block out the light from the street, so it was a bit hard to sleep because the room was pretty light. The beds were also very hard. Overall the room was very clean and tidy and had new fittings. It is right next to the entrance to Euston Square Tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Bit grotty, noisy and in a less than desirable location”
Reviews.Author: JamesSharpe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times now in the Euston Sq hotel, and to be honest is last of a very long list of places I would consider when trying to get a room (when all others are full including the Travelodge) The rooms try to be minimalist but this is a thin veneer disguising the cheap decor. Decorated about three years ago the rooms are soiled, tired and basic compared to its peers. The walls are paper thin and as a result all televisions are set at a maximum volume that prevents even the most able bodied in hearing them. As for their perpendicular posture which means you have to lay cross ways on the bed to see them is a mystery to me? Must be their minimalist design philosophy! The shades in the room cut out about 50% of the light, and the noise of the busy arterial London road or drunken groups outside will guarantee to keep you awake so you will need to bring ear plugs (highly recommended) and / or blindfold if you like your beauty sleep. Cost cutting extends further to the AC which was installed throughout the hotel over the past couple of years. You will be excited to find AC in the room only to have your hopes dashed by the automatic cut out which seems to kick in every 20minutes or so switching the machine off (think about all those polar bears you are saving or better still the pounds you will lose in the sauna of a room that results!) The food is pretty basic and bar a bit pricy too. Some redeeming facts - itâ€™s a stone through to Euston,- OK if you have an early morning train departure planned, (my advice would be to travel to your destination the night before and staying a better quality cheaper pad instead) um thatâ€™s it for redeeming qualities - no wait one more, your right opposite the emergency room of St Thomas's hospital. Which of course is ideal if you are unlucky enough to have to stay more than one night in a row on account of you not having to crawl any distance to receive treatment and rest bite for undoubted exhaustion following the sleep deprivation you will experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,breakfast included in the price”
Reviews.Author: richcath1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this well located hotel,right next to Euston Square underground station. The hotel has been refitted in recent times and is really quite nice.A decent buffet breakfast is included in the price which is a rare treat in hotels now. Be warned that the rooms are small,a couple of nights is all you would want to stay for.That said the room we had had everything you need & the fixtures and fittings were all pretty decent.Cheap soap though,even by hotel standards.The blind didn't darken the room much either. All in all though OK for the price,by London standards that is.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all bad!”
Reviews.Author: lisdilure
Reviews.Content: To start with, we had to pay up front for both nights which I found unusual and disconcerting, I had furnished a credit card number to book the rooms. The location is good, very close to two tube stations, also within walking distance of a number of attractions. Six of us stayed in 3 rooms which I would discribe as 'dinky'(small!) but were very clean with lovely en-suite shower rooms. My limited experience of staying in London leads me to believe that space in an hotel room costs money and for the amount of time one spends in the room there is no point in spending the money on larger rooms! The continental breakfast included in the price was lovely, bread, toast, cereals, pastries, etc. It annoys me that a cappucino cost extra but it often does. Hotel staff were not especially friendly but did order taxis for us and helpfully accomodated our early departure, ensuring that we had breakfast. Overall, I would return to the hotel as I feel it is as good a compromise as can be expected so close to London centre.

Reviews.Title: “GO ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: foxilaidee
Reviews.Content: Arriving approximately 13:15 after a long journey, the male receptionist was not welcoming. His abrupt' wait over there, there are others before you' left a lot to be desired. The room, which we had booked almost 2 monts before, was extremely small, there was no TV, Safe, or chair, so to use a lap top would necessitate sitting on the small double bed. There was no towel rack in the bathroom and no aids for elderly or infirm people to assist in and out of the shower, which had a step up. Stepping out was equally precarious as there was nothing to hold onto, should you need it. The room was clean and airy, but there was absolutely nowhere to place suitcases, other than in front of the bed, again, if you need the loo during the night, there would be a safety issue, particularly on the window side of the bed, which you had to walk side ways as the space was so tight. Breakfast was good, stick to the continental ,as the English, for which you pay more, is not plentiful, cold and greasy., and at Â£6.50 not good value. Our room was not cheap and if you had to spend any time in it, other than for sleeping, was too cramped and uncomfortable. Indeed the room itself was smaller than the single student accommodation I stayed at in Westminster ( Â£25, but no breakfast) To stay or not? My advice for young back packers..fine, but for anyone who likes some basic comfort, give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “My cupboard at home is bigger!”
Reviews.Author: the_other_other_guy
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel' is BY FAR the bearer of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. DO NOT stay here if you are travelling with anything bigger than a chia pet. It is in a very handy location for the tube - right on top of the NORTH exit of the Euston Square stop - mind the gap. We stayed here because we were taking the Eurostar to Paris in the morning, so it was handy. It was a 10 minute walk to King's Cross/St. Pancras station, but on the way there, I passed a few more hotels - including a Premier Inn! - So I HIGHLY recommend you stay at the Premier Inn instead! Always cheaper!...and no doubt more room! If you do choose the Premier Inn - and you should - still exit the Euston Square tube station but use the south exit and go right on the street, then right at the corner - the Premier Inn will be on that side of the street a few blocks down - closer to St. Pancras than the broom closet known as the Euston Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: The location is great. 10-15 minutes walk to Oxford St and 15-20 minutes walk to theatres. Lot of buses going too around this hotel and ofcourse, tube runs everywhere. Rooms are very nice and updated, but kind of small. A/C had an odd sound couple of times, but that didn't bother us. Internet connection was good, it's free and you get a access codes from reception. Breakfast was a small disappointment, there were absolutely no vegetables (like cucumber, tomatoes etc) and cheese ran out every morning. And the waitress was the slowest ever to put new cheese to the table. But still, one of the best hotels I've visited in London and I'm going there again. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “It's Squared alright~”
Reviews.Author: shez12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not really close to anything spectacular but the metro right outside makes it easy to access the areas you want to go. The overall decor of the establishment and rooms are modern and clean. The room was a bit of a let down for the price we paid. The furnishings seem to big for the room hence the lack of room once the bed was in, air-con is controlled by reception (kept automatically turning itself off ~ not a gd especially when travelling in Summer time), was quite loud at night if you got a front facing room even with the window closed and the drainage for the shower was quite slow as well. Breakfast however was a good selection as well as the free wifi provided upon request. The lift was not working on the last day of our stay.. which was quite troublesome especially if your on the higher floor. Overall, staff were nice and even offered to do free printing for us. But would probably stay elsewhere next time round

Reviews.Title: “Euro Trip - London”
Reviews.Author: Midi82
Reviews.Content: Did the job! Room: JUST OK: Stayed 5 nights in a double room and the room was TINY! Needless to say, the bathroom was also tiny! HOWEVER, the room and bathroom was clean which was my main priority; you get used to the size of the room (sort of) but you'll spend the day out and about so the small size wasn't really an issue; NEGATIVE: hotel is on a main road so you will hear a bit of traffic - best to keep the windows closed; air con on timer but its better than no air con right?! Service: GOOD: Check in and out was quick and easy; Free wifi - very good addition; service was good enough Food: OK: we had breakfast included and although there wasn't a lot of variety, it was enough; they also organised soy milk and a gluten free cereal for my wife which was a nice touch Location: EXCELLENT; two minute walk from Euston Station; 10min walk to St. Pancrea's; we walked to/from most major sights from the hotel; when we didn't walk, tube and buses got us to the hotel Overall: OK: If the size of things doesn't concern you then this hotel, if not, area, is a very good base to start your London sightseeing providing the price suits; I probably wouldn't stay in this hotel again purely b/c i'd like to experience another hotel in the same area; however, if the price was right, then i would stay here again TIP: if catching a connecting train from St. Pancreas - walk it - don't bother with the tube b/c it'll set you back close to 10 pounds for 2 ppl verses a 10-15min walk with luggage - FOR FREE! Plus, the hotel next to the station provides a good photo opp!

Reviews.Title: “Bad from the first sight”
Reviews.Author: Abadi_in_London
Reviews.Content: - no early check in -very small room - not that clean - very small non comfortable bed - no curtains - AC makes noise every 5 min...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room"”
Reviews.Author: JGTripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel. The location was excellent, but our room looked over a very busy street, so was very noisy with the windows open. The airconditioning was on a timer, so we needed to restart it periodically to keep the room ventilated. We reserved two double rooms. When we got there, one room was acceptable, but the other room was so tiny that we couldn't even get to one side of the bed once we got our luggage in the room. There were desks in each room, but no chairs. There was nowhere to open the luggage except on the floor. This hotel is much better suited to more local travelers who don't have large pieces of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “great location - apalling room size”
Reviews.Author: melandjon
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is very convenient - close to several tube stations and walking distance to many areas of interest (e.g. oxford street). we had looked at the reviews on trip advisor and also the hotel website - but were still not prepared for the ridiculously small size of the room. the free continental breakfast and wifi were bonuses, but would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I followed the trip advisor advice on this one!”
Reviews.Author: BimboDarling
Reviews.Content: I was planning a weekend away with my friends and wanted somewhere to stay that was friendly, good value and with good access to public transport. This hotel seemed to tick all the boxes and I wasn't disappointed... We checked in on friday night, we had driven over and were very pleased to discover we could park right outside the hotel for free for the duration of our two day stay! The girl on check in was helpful and efficient. We went up to our rooms, my friends had a double and I had a single. My room was compact but clean and had plenty of storage space and plug sockets. My only complaint would be that I had to plug the kettle in on the floor. The room could have probably benefitted from some bedside lamps too. The bathroom was nice and modern and the shower hot and powerful. When we got back wanting the buy a bottle of wine later on the staff were very helpful and were happy to let us sit on the nice cosy sofas in reception to drink it. Breakfast was a continental one with nice fresh fruit salad, ham cheese, pastries, yogurt, breads and a choice of cereals and fruit juices. You could have a full english cooked for you for an extra charge but we were more than happy with what we had. The bar was well stocked and not too expensive and we thought they had a great selection of very affordable, drinkable wines. The only issues I had during my stay was that my friend was coming to join us on the second day, I wanted to leave my key but the receptionists said not to worry, just to leave her name and they would give her a key to get into the room. Unfortunately the staff changed shift, the information was lost and they new staff wouldn't let her into the room. Luckily we weren't far away but it could have been a bit of a disaster if we were. The other issue I had was with getting the cleaning knock at 9am on our checkout date. It is a bit of a pet hate of mine, we are booked in until 11... We haven't checked out yet, please leave us to enjoy our sleep. The beds are lovely and comfy by the way. We all slept really well throughout our stay. The girl that cleans the rooms was very sweet, I wanted extra milk, tea and coffee and she very kindly fetched more for me. I highly recommend this hotel, the staff are lovely and friendly, they did their best to really look after us throughout our stay. The hotel is clean and modern, the rooms small but comfortable and great value for what we paid. They also have free wireless which was good too. We all enjoyed staying here and I would definately recommend this hotel if you are staying in London.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but small ....”
Reviews.Author: Saffyhound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok for 1 or 2 nights. The room was reasonably clean but it could do with some attention in parts. The bedroom was really small but ok for one person. The bathroom was really really small, almost too small to turn around in. That said, the bed was comfortable and I had a great night's sleep as the room I was in was at the back of the hotel and there was very little outside noise. Good location - 3 mins walk from Euston. A plus is the free wireless internet - if you have your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: OzOwen
Reviews.Content: The two things that stand out about this hotel are: its way way way to expensive for what you actually get and the room is almost the smallest I have ever seen (def the smallest with a double bed though). Once you took into account the bed, the wardrobe, the tv cabinet i don't think there was a 1 square meter of actual carpet left bare. Even the elevator and corridors are tiny and claustrophobic. For the amount charged its absurd. having said that the place was well kept, clean and 'modern' looking. The breakfast was well cooked and the dinning area pleasant. The tv based internet was very cumbersome to use and they kept trying to overcharge me for its use. I you want a tiny, clean room that is overpriced, this is the place for you! You can get a room 80% bigger for about half price in many other locations, ok they will be a little more dated but believe me they are much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Should be much better for the price”
Reviews.Author: marieandjohn
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in London on business and this hotel is one of the worst I've stayed in. The room was small and pokey, the bed was uncomfortable and the toilet didn't flush properly. For somebody who didn't know London well and wasn't too concerned about getting a lot of sleep the location would be great, it's right next to Euston Square Station and is very easy to find. On the downside it's VERY noisy and my room had a plastic venetian blind which didn't close properly which meant that the sun came streaming in at 5am! Curtains would be a great addition! Breakfast was good, but overall could do much better for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMT44
Reviews.Content: We arrived in London via the Eurostar before check-in time. Left our luggage at hotel, no problem, and went off sightseeing. Hotel very conveniently located. Room was very clean, bed a bit firm. Free wifi in rooms, superb continental breakfast. Left luggage at hotel after check-out in order to get some more sightseeing in before our train departed. This hotel caters very well to tourists who want a place to lay their heads at night, while spending the day out in London. I highly recommend it. Only down side was the late-night revellers returning noisily at the early hours of the night. Although they went right to their rooms, their passage was loud and disturbed us. Recommend you ask for a room away from the stairs/elevator to avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Ezekielette
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay on our honeymoon and booked based on Tripadvisor reviews. We arrived 6am in the morning so we were able to leave our luggage in the storage compartment while we explored London. The room was excellent; exceptionally clean which was most important to me. We were on the second floor (stairs, no lift). We were worried about the noise as it's on the main road but the room had soundproof glass which really helped (though you could hear sirens, the odd drunks walking by) and I had good earplugs. The walls between the rooms were a bit thin and could hear music from the next room, but a good bang on the wall worked. Room was cleaned daily, sheets and towels changed daily as well. Room contained small LCD tv, tea and coffee facilities, hairdryer and safe. Breakfast was included in the rate, and the breakfast was great. A buffet of cereals, fruit, toast, pastries, hot and cold drinks. It really filled us up for the day. The restaurant at night was also good; very quite, and the food was good quality when you couldn't be bothered to find somewhere else to eat. Location was excellent; Euston Square station underneath the hotel, and a couple of others within 5 minutes walking distance away. Located about 5-10 minute walk from shops and restaurant and about 30 minute walk to Trafalgar Square. The disappointing part about the stay there was that the staff weren't very friendly, but in the grand scheme of it all, not a huge big deal. We managed to get a good deal, paid Â£80 a night. Expensive (as London is) but it had all the facilities we needed and close to everything we wanted to do. Hotel also had free WiFi which was handy. I would definately recommend staying here, particularly if you're just using it to sleep at night while you're exploring all day!

Reviews.Title: “Poor room for the price paid !”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: To best describe the room I had, I would say it was build for a person who is about 3 years old. How one person is supposed to move in and about in it is beyond me. Clean/tidy yes but dreadful for an adult. To squeeze pass the bed is an effort. The bathroom is so compact, tight fitting shower. Do not recommend this hotel for the pricees they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinBackPacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend get away with my 3 friends for new years eve. We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and it was exactly what we needed, yes the rooms are quite small and basic but they are all you need for a short stay and are kept very clean. The area it is located in is FANTASTIC! Right beside the tube station, literally next door to it! There is also a little cafe called speedys across the road, we ate here for breakfast. It's a charming little spot with great friendly staff. The hotel say breakfast is included but it is very basic food served. Also there are a few supermarkets, a Boots(very handy) and resturants close by. The bar in the hotel is nice and quite big and drinks are a good price. The staff were very friendly and the bar staff are lovely and we had a bit of craic with them. Reception will order taxis for you from a private company that will give pick you up outside the hotel and charge good prices they can also organise them to pick you up and bring you back to the hotel. All in all this hotel is ideal for a city break and prices are reasonable

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms - good location”
Reviews.Author: pjr59
Reviews.Content: very small rooms - good location but there are many hotels close by we were in the smallest room on the floor (according to the fire exit map) the shower was not a square shaped stall but almost a triangle to fit into the tiny bathroom - my 6 foot husband had to step out of the shower to raise his arms to wash his hair!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with modern bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Mamamolu
Reviews.Content: TINY room - I couldn't even open the bathroom door without hitting the bed. Also the beds were rock hard. BUT... what a little gem! Nicely located with sound proof windows - which is good because there are ambulances coming in and out of a nearby hospital all day and night. Very modern and stylish bathroom with shower. It included continental breakfast which normally is just some dry toast and coffee/tra, but this was very good! Different kinds of bread; cheese ham and different spreads; two different juices, cereals, fresh fruit salad etc. I was very happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Skiwhizz
Reviews.Content: Ideal location next to Euston Square tube and Warren St tube is just over the flyover, which meant it was safe for a woman travelling on her own (me) to get back in the dark without having to worry. As most people have said, the rooms are tiny. I was only there for 2 nights so only had a small bag. No room to put a suitcase anywhere. The telly was rubbish, not that it caused me a problem as I was out in the evenings. If you need entertainment, bring a DVD player or something!! Also, the soundproofing wasn't brilliant, so ear plugs were useful. My bathroom was small, but not as cramped as some of the others, judging by previous comments. No plug in the sink was a pain though - perhaps this should be mentioned to them - talk about wasting water!! The continental breakfast was fine - lots of choice of cereals, pastries, hot drinks etc - quite impressed with it. Didn't have any problems with the staff. The checkin was fast and efficient, and it wasn't a problem leaving my bag there on the last morning and collecting it before my train back home. It was locked in an area behind the reception, so perfectly safe. Overall, I would stay again because the location is so good, and it was easy walking to Russell Square, Holborn etc. Quite nice to see London at street level rather than stuck down in the Tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel good location!”
Reviews.Author: rabbit29
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Euston square hotel for 1 night, the reception and bar staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room we stayed in was very small but clean and as the purpose of this hotel was simply just to sleep in, it had everything we needed. Less than a minute away is a tube station and there are a coulpe more a short distance walk away. This hotel was perfect for us as we wanted to explore and do all the sight seeing of London. I would reccomend this hotel for people who wanted basic not for anyone who would spend lots of time within the hotel. Breakfast was basic but fresh and again the staff were welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: DygAroselie
Reviews.Content: easy to get around,very clean,nice staff,room a bit small but breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Too minimalistic”
Reviews.Author: LjoJo
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a hotwire reservation. Fairly good location - Euston Square Tube station next door, but a good walk from Oxford Street. Rooms not too bad for a budget hotel in London - clean and with duvets - no blankets, but very minimalistic. Safe in room was a bonus. Corridors very run down and gives impression of a youth hostel. Reception area modern but totally soulless. Would staybagain provided price was Ok - but paying more than 30 pounds p.p.n. would make we search elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Bijou with a capital 'B'”
Reviews.Author: LancashireShirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Euston Square Hotel on the second floor room 215 & sons stayed in 203. As one of my sons was travelling on from London we let the boys have room 203 as it was far quieter than our room. Euston Sqare Hotel is right on the corner of Euston Road & North Gower Street only a few minutes from Euston Rail & right on top of the entrance for Euston Square Tube & I mean on top of it, it actually goes underneath the hotel. This was very convenient for us as that is where we wanted to start the next day's journey. Unfortunately room 215 was right opp the lift in the hotel our door being 3 foot away but as it only opened once or twice during the night it didn't disturb us. What did however was the constant traffic , non stop all night & like other people have said, police cars on sirens about 6 times during the early hours. The rooms are tiny, just enough room to get round 1 side of the bed. 1 bedside cabinet , small dressing table & wardrobe. The bedding was clean & the room was clean. Bathroom was just as tiny & both our rooms were exactly the same. If you just want somewhere to lay down your head than this hotel is perfect as long as you manage somehow to get a room where the traffic does not disturb you all night long. The corridor carpet looked a bit tired but hey I am not sleeping in the corridor. There were plent of fire doors & smoke alarms which is big on my list. I quite liked the continental breakfast , good quality ham , cheese & a nice selection of rolls or you could have cereal, toast jam etc. Staff were fine , pleasant enough. I would recommend this hotel with the following reservation:- Do not stay here is you want a guaranteed good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for easy reach of tubes!”
Reviews.Author: primarkqueenDorset
Reviews.Content: helpful service from all staff, clean hotel and restaurant, breakfast was great with lots to choose from e.g. frest fruit salad, cereals, toast and croissants. Rooms are a good size with a nice shower room and easy to use heating, linen was changed every day and rooms were spotless. we found warren street tube was the best to commute to and from city centre, and to get to the main attractions, and the hotel offers lots of leaflets and a computer to see what's happening in London.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Crococat
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel trough hotwire, which means you dont know in advance which htl exactly you book. public areas are quite ok. rooms are very poor. terrible lighting, cold, tiny, did not really feel clean. Definately a very basic 3 star if not 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: kateylynn
Reviews.Content: We spent a nightmare night at this hotel. When we checked in, the desk clerk asked us if we would like a "quiet" room. I shudder to think what a noisy room is like at this hotel, if we were given a quiet one! We were given a room on the second floor facing the side street. All night long, sirens from ambulances and police cars woke us repeatedly. The light from the street glared in the window, as there are no drapes to deaden sound or block the light. Voices at street level also woke us. The room itself was so tiny, we could barely move around. The bed was up against the wall and was not comfortable. The bathroom was the size of a closet. We had to check out early and they reluctantly let us have a bowl of cold cereal and instant coffee. a bad mark on an otherwise great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Toilets for small people?”
Reviews.Author: larry_karkkainen
Reviews.Content: The room I got when I made my reservation was nr 412 and it was more like a wardrobe than a hotel room. I tried to use the toilet, but the space between the toilet seat and the wall right opposite was too small. I'm a normal size Finnish man (1,87 meter) but the toilet is obviously designed for midgets. I was given the opportunity to upgrade my room for an extra prize. The room is for disabled people and is spacious, the only thing that bothers here is the lack of sound isolation (thin walls, singular windows, first floor) - but I can live with this. I have asked for a compensation for upgrading my room, because I couldn't use the room this hotel offered me. I had booked the nights between the 26th and 30th of October so the extra fee made 40 pounds. I wrote in the morning an email directed to the Manager of the hotel about this. It's evening now and I'm waiting for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: grandtourists
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for a business trip and are so pleased we found the Euston Square! Clean, comfortable and great staff - very helpful throughout from the reception desk to the bar - special thanks to Mohamed! Our room was small but had everything we needed and the bathroom was more than adequate. We asked on booking for a quiet room and got one - no problem with noise despite the hotel's proximity to Euston Road. The buffet breakfast was good with a reasonable choice. A big advantage is the hotel's location - 5 minutes walk from Euston Station and next to the entrance to Euston Square tube station - and only 2 blocks from Drummond Street with a truly fantastic selection of real ale pubs, curry houses and a range of other local restaurants, all of which combine to make it feel more like a village than central London.
